item.title: Expression statements
item.description: An expression statement is an expression followed by a semicolon (;). The execution of the statements causes the expression to be evaluated. Code example a = 0; a++; b = 3 + c; y = (a * x) + b; printf("Speed = %f", x); ; // the semicolon itself is an expression
